description.narrative: To work to improve regulatory standards governing Chile's aquaculture industry, with specific emphasis on the salmon and mussel farming that has brought destructive environmental impacts to pristine coastal regions of Patagonia. The organization will develop a monitoring and outreach program related to salmon farming, especially highlight recent regulatory changes that may carry sanitary, environmental, and social impacts for local communities. It will continue work to support local CSOs working on aquaculture issues, and will maintain and expand national network of like-minded organizations. TERRAM will undertake studies on the impacts of mussel farming, industry that is expanding in the region at a very fast rate but that falls beyond the scope of recent regulatory reforms. It will continue data collection on the environmental impacts of Chile's salmon farming industry
